item.title: Setup a fully Private Amazon EKS on AWS Fargate Cluster
item.description: Regulated industries needs to host their Kubernetes workloads in most secure ways and fully private EKS on Fargate cluster attempts to solve this problem. Each pod running on Fargate has its own isolation boundary and does not share the underlying kernel, CPU resources, memory resources, or elastic network interface with another pod, which makes it secure from compliance point of view.
